item.title: Blocked. have complained about this drain before there seems to be a recurring problem with it, 23rd September
item.description:
Adjacent to the corner of the rear carpark of 27a st georges road. The council should also clean the streets of the leaves when they know that a very bad storm is forecast. The leaves block the drains in seconds causing flooding of propertys. There appears to be only 2 drains on st georges road im guessing the intention is that the water will flow down hill. However it brings massive amounts of leaves with it and when it hits the junction the water turns into st georges place. At this point it is a river and the drains in st georges place can not cope with all the water from st georges road. Leaves immediatley block the drains and propertys are flooded because the council wont clear the leaves in the street.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 100, Saint Georges Place, Montpellier, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Drain outside driveway. Already caused flooding of two properties., 23rd September
item.description:
Drain outside of no. 80 (Elmwood) Rowanfield Road. Issue has been present for months, reported multiple times. Caused flooding to two properties on Friday 20th Sep. No action taken to clear drain, only to replace tarmac in repeatedly collapsing sink hole.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 80, Rowanfield Road, Hatherley, Cheltenham

item.title: Drain and culvert blocked causing flooding into road, 23rd September
item.description:
The drain and culvert outside 17 Harvey's Road Winchcombe are blocked. The water pressure is lifting the drain cover and causing flooding and depositing debris across the road. The problem began 22/09/2024 with the heavy rainfall. The culvert beneath the drain runs constantly taking water from Langley Hill.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Harvey's Lane, Winchcombe, Winchcombe, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Gullys not cleared, 23rd September
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hartley Lane, Shurdington, Tewkesbury

item.category: Other damage to pavement i.e. cobbles, raised mound/surface

item.title: Glebe road flood, threat to health and properties., 23rd September
item.description:
Drains are ineffective, have now been informed by a worker from highways agency contractor who was working on the road flood issue that the drains have collapsed and it has been known for some time after highways conducted an investigation, dates to be confirmed. Water has now reached into properties, drives ways and gardens, some of which are now starting to flood, this is from the water from the road. This is happening now as the water has no place to go and has found the easiest route to the excessive amount of water. The fresh water valves into the properties are filled with dirty water, oil is also present in the flood water .This could lead to fresh water issues if there are any undetected leaks, properties also have young babies and people with health problems. Now having to boil water to ensure it is safe for consumption for the moment. This issue has now gotten to a point where health could be a concern and this has been going on for 5 years.since I've been living here and before me. The flooding is now so serve when vehicles where driving through it where causing bow waves and the water was washing right up to the occupiers front doors. Road has now been closed but the water is still rising and there are no provisions, sand bags to stop the water from rising any further on the properties.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 26, Glebe Road, Lynworth, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
